alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:26PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cache and northeastern Box Elder Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 325 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Plymouth, or 11 miles north of Tremonton, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarkston, Plymouth, Riverside, Fielding, Cornish, Portage and Washakie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 385 and 400. Interstate 84 between mile markers 28 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
